intro: Vernonia spathulifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually broad and lance-shaped, with a rough texture, and it produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. Vernonia spathulifolia is often found in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to a variety of environmental conditions.
